tool.name: DownloadImgbyTag

param.name: asset_tag
param.dialogReference: The asset tag could be found at the dataset information page. For example, “ee.ImageCollection('COPERNICUS/S2_SR')” loads the Google Earth Engine Image Collection by asset tag "COPERNICUS/S2_SR".

param.name: bands
param.dialogReference: The image dataset could contain multiple bands. Select the target bands to download. The user can select as many as needed.

param.name: scale
param.dialogReference: Specify the scale of the downloaded GeoTIFF in meters. The default scale uses the maximum scale among the selected bands.

param.name: in_poly
param.displayname: Choose a polygon as region of interest
param.dialogReference: Choose a polygon feature layer as the region of interest to download the GeoTIFF. The image will be clipped by the polygon extent.

param.name: use_extent
param.displayname: Use the current map view extent as region of interest
param.dialogReference: Check this box if using the current map extent as the region of interest.

param.name: out_tiff
param.dialogReference: Specify the full path of the output GeoTIFF file.

param.name: load_tiff
param.displayname: Load images to map after download
param.dialogReference: Check this box if the user wants to load the output GeoTIFF file to the current map after download.

tool.summary: This script downloads the Earth Engine image dataset to GeoTIFF by its asset tag. It converts Earth Engine image object to xarray dataset using 'xee' and writes to local GeoTIFF file using 'rasterio'. Theoretically, there is no file size limitation compared to other functions such as ee.Image.getDownloadURL() and ee.data.getPixels(). Larger files will take longer to download.
